<article class="entry"> 
  <dfn title="color"><sup>1</sup>col·or</dfn> <span epub:type="pron">\ˈkə-lər\</span>  
  <span epub:type="pos"><i>n</i></span>,  
  <span epub:type="gram-info"><i>often attrib</i></span> 
  <span epub:type="etym">[<small>ORIGIN</small>: ME <i>colour,</i> fr. AF, fr. L <i>color;</i> akin to L <i>celare</i> to conceal — more at <a href="#DUMMY"><small>HELL</small></a>]</span> 
  <section class="block">(13c) 
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block"> 
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1a"><b>1 a</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: a phenomenon of light (as red, brown, pink, or gray) or visual perception that enables one to differentiate otherwise identical objects</span>  
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1b(1)"><b>b <span class="normal">(1)</span></b></span> <span epub:type="def">: the aspect of the appearance of objects and light sources that may be described in terms of hue, lightness, and saturation for objects and hue, brightness, and saturation for light sources <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;the changing ∼ of the sky&gt;</span></span>; <i>also</i> <span epub:type="def">: a specific combination of hue, saturation, and lightness or brightness <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;comes in six ∼<i>s</i>&gt;</span></span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1b(2)"><b><span class="normal">(2)</span></b></span> <span epub:type="def">: a color other than and as contrasted with black, white, or gray</span>
    </section>
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="2a"><b>2 a</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: an outward often deceptive show : <a href="#DUMMY"><small>APPEARANCE</small></a> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;his story has the ∼ of truth&gt;</span></span>  
      <span epub:type="snum" title="2b"><b>b</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: a legal claim to or appearance of a right, authority, or office</span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="2c"><b>c</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: a pretense offered as justification : <a href="#DUMMY"><small>PRETEXT</small></a> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;she could have drawn from the Versailles treaty the ∼ of legality for any action she chose  —<i>Yale Rev.</i>&gt;</span></span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="2d"><b>d</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: an appearance of authenticity : <a href="#DUMMY"><small>PLAUSIBILITY</small></a> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;lending ∼ to this notion&gt;</span></span>
    </section>
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block"> 
      <span epub:type="snum" title="3"><b>3</b></span> <span epub:type="def"> : complexion tint:</span>  <span epub:type="snum" title="3a"><b>a</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: the tint characteristic of good health</span>  <span epub:type="snum" title="3b"><b>b</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: <a href="#DUMMY"><small>BLUSH</small></a> </span>
    </section>
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="4a"><b>4 a</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: vividness or variety of effects of language</span>

    </section>
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="5a"><b>5 a</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: an identifying badge, pennant, or flag — usu. used in pl. <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;a ship sailing under Swedish ∼<i>s</i>&gt;</span></span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="5b"><b>b</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: colored clothing distinguishing one as a member of a particular group or representative of a particular person or thing — usu. used in pl. <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;a jockey wearing the ∼<i>s</i> of the stable&gt;</span></span>
    </section>
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">

      <span epub:type="snum" title="6b"><b>b</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: <a href="#DUMMY"><small>CHARACTER</small></a>,  <a href="#DUMMY"><small>NATURE</small></a> — usu. used in pl. <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;showed himself in his true ∼<i>s</i>&gt;</span></span>

    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">

    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">

    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="13"><b>13</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: a small particle of gold in a gold miner's pan after washing</span>

  <section class="block"> (bef. 12c) 
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1a"><b>1 a</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to be or to stay at rest in a horizontal position : be <a href="#DUMMY"><small>PROSTRATE</small></a> : <a href="#DUMMY"><small>REST</small></a>,  <a href="#DUMMY"><small>RECLINE</small></a> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;∼ motionless&gt;</span> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;∼ asleep&gt;</span></span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1b"><b>b</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to assume a horizontal position — often used with <i>down</i></span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1c"><b>c</b></span> <i>archaic</i> <span epub:type="def">: to reside temporarily : stay for the night : <a href="#DUMMY"><small>LODGE</small></a></span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1d"><b>d</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to have sexual intercourse — used with <i>with</i></span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1e"><b>e</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to remain inactive (as in concealment) <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;∼ in wait&gt;</span></span>
    </section>

      <span epub:type="snum" title="2"><b>2</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to be in a helpless or defenseless state <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;the town <i>lay</i> at the mercy of the invaders&gt;</span></span>
    </section>
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="3"><b>3</b></span> <i>of an inanimate thing</i> <span epub:type="def">: to be or remain in a flat or horizontal position upon a broad support <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;books <i>lying</i> on the table&gt;</span></span>
    </section>
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="4"><b>4</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to have direction : <a href="#DUMMY"><small>EXTEND</small></a> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;the route <i>lay</i> to the west&gt;</span></span>
    </section>
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="5a"><b>5 a</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to occupy a certain relative place or position <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;hills ∼ behind us&gt;</span></span>  
      <span epub:type="snum" title="5b"><b>b</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to have a place in relation to something else <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;the real reason ∼<i>s</i> deeper&gt;</span></span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="5c"><b>c</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to have an effect through <a href="#DUMMY"><small>MERE</small></a> presence, weight, or relative position <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;remorse <i>lay</i> heavily on him&gt;</span></span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="5d"><b>d</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to be sustainable or admissible</span>

    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="6"><b>6</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to remain at anchor or <a href="#DUMMY"><small>BECALMED</small></a></span>

    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">

      <span epub:type="snum" title="7b"><b>b</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: <a href="#DUMMY"><small>CONSIST</small></a>,  <a href="#DUMMY"><small>BELONG</small></a> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;the success of the book ∼<i>s</i> in its direct style&gt;</span> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;responsibility <i>lay</i> with the adults&gt;</span></span>

<article class="entry">
  <dfn title="lie"><sup>3</sup>lie</dfn>
  <span epub:type="pron">\ˈlī\</span>
  <span epub:type="pos"><i>vb</i></span>
  <b>lied</b>; <b>ly·ing</b> <span epub:type="pron">\ˈlī-iŋ\</span>
  <span epub:type="etym">[<small>ORIGIN</small>: ME, fr. OE <i>lēogan;</i> akin to OHG <i>liogan</i> to lie, OCS <i>lŭgati</i>]</span> 
  <section class="block" epub:type="pos-group">
    ▪ <span epub:type="pos"><i>vi</i></span> (bef. 12c) 
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1"><b>1</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to make an untrue statement with <a href="#DUMMY"><small>INTENT</small></a> to deceive</span>
    </section>
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="2"><b>2</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: to create a false or misleading impression</span>
    </section>
  </section>
  <section class="block" epub:type="pos-group">
    ▪ <span epub:type="pos"><i>vt</i></span> 
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="def">: to bring about by telling lies <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;<i>lied</i> his way out of trouble&gt;</span></span>
    </section>
  </section>
  <section epub:type="syn-group">
    <blockquote>
      <p>
        <b><i>synonyms</i></b> <small>LIE</small>, <small>PREVARICATE</small>, <small>EQUIVOCATE</small>, <small>PALTER</small>, <small>FIB</small> mean to tell an untruth. 
        <small>LIE</small> is the blunt term, imputing dishonesty <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;<i>lied</i> about where he had been&gt;</span>. 
        <small>PREVARICATE</small> softens the bluntness of <small>LIE</small> by implying quibbling or confusing the issue <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;during the hearings the witness did his best to <i>prevaricate</i>&gt;</span>.
        <small>EQUIVOCATE</small> implies using words having more than one sense so as to seem to say one thing but intend another <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;<i>equivocated</i> endlessly in an attempt to mislead her inquisitors&gt;</span>.
        <small>PALTER</small> implies making unreliable statements of fact or intention or insincere promises <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;a swindler <i>paltering</i> with his investors&gt;</span>.
        <small>FIB</small> applies to a telling of a trivial untruth <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;<i>fibbed</i> about the price of the new suit&gt;</span>.
      </p>
    </blockquote>
  </section>
</article>

<article class="entry">
  <dfn title="light"><sup>1</sup>light</dfn>
  <span epub:type="pron">\ˈlīt\</span>
  <span epub:type="pos"><i>n</i></span>
  <span epub:type="etym">[<small>ORIGIN</small>: ME, fr. OE <i>lēoht;</i> akin to OHG <i>lioht</i> light, L <i>luc-, lux</i> light, <i>lucēre</i> to shine, Gk <i>leukos</i> white]</span>
  <section class="block">(bef. 12c) 
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1a"><b>1 a</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: something that makes vision possible</span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1b"><b>b</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: the sensation aroused by stimulation of the visual receptors</span>
      <span epub:type="snum" title="1c"><b>c</b></span> <span epub:type="def">: electromagnetic radiation of any wavelength that travels in a vacuum with a speed of about 186,281 miles (300,000 kilometers) per second</span>; <i>specif</i> <span epub:type="def">: such radiation that is visible to the human eye</span>
    </section>
    <section epub:type="sense-group" class="block">
